metadata.Description: Energy demand from urbanization refers to the increasing energy needs of urban areas due to population growth and urban development.

level 1.Description: The increasing energy demand from urbanization is addressed through the implementation of smart grid technology to optimize energy distribution and consumption.
To manage the energy demand from urbanization, various energy efficiency measures are employed to reduce energy consumption and promote sustainable development.
Efforts to address the energy demand from urbanization involve collaboration with city planning departments to integrate sustainable energy solutions into urban development plans.
To meet the increasing energy demand from urbanization, support is provided to renewable energy projects that can provide clean and reliable energy sources.
To encourage energy efficiency in urban areas, the administration of energy efficiency incentive programs is carried out to promote the adoption of energy-saving practices.
The energy demand from urbanization is measured to assess the energy consumption patterns and identify areas for improvement and optimization.
Efforts to address the energy demand from urbanization align with the Sustainable Development Goals, particularly in terms of affordable and clean energy access for all.
The increasing energy demand from urbanization is an instance of the ongoing global energy transition towards sustainable and low-carbon energy systems.

level 2.Subject: smart metering technologies
level 2.Description: Smart metering technologies implement the Energy Efficiency Policy by providing real-time data on energy consumption.

level 2.Subject: smart metering technologies
level 2.Description: Smart metering technologies contribute funds to research and development projects for improving energy efficiency.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency collaborates with industries to develop and implement energy-saving measures and technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 3.Subject: energy cooperatives
level 3.Description: Energy cooperatives address energy poverty by providing affordable and sustainable energy solutions to underserved communities.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.
